title: Barba: I might never play NRL again | League | Sporting News
text:
January 31, 2017 7:53pm EST January 31, 2017 7:33pm EST Ben Barba says he might never play in the NRL again after news broke overnight that he had signed a deal to play rugby union for French powerhouse Toulon. Andy Silver 
Published on Jan. 31, 2017 
Jan. 31, 2017 
Ben Barba says he might never play in the NRL again after news broke overnight that he had signed a deal to play rugby union for French powerhouse Toulon. 
The Sharks' premiership winning fullback was suspended by the NRL after failing a drugs test and has signed a short-term contract with Toulon. 
The 27-year-old was re-signed by Cronulla, but the contract hasn’t been ratified by the NRL. 
The situation has led Barba to confirm that he may not return to the 13-man game. 
“I’m not too sure, the NRL haven’t given me much, so it’s probably the first time we’ve talked,” Barba said when approached by TV journos outside his house on Wednesday morning. 
“I’ve gotta look after my kids and my family and they’re my first option. Nothing’s been final yet, so at the moment I’m just listening to the people who take care of me and I’ll go from there. 
“The NRL hasn’t given me much and if it comes to that, I might never play the game again, so I’ll just go from there and listen to the guys who take care of me. 
“We’ll make the decision at the end of the day. 
“They’ve had quite a while to sort my stuff out but it’s taken them three months and nothing’s been sorted out.”
